required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Family Literacy Program for Latino Families
clinical_study.official_title: Ready and Healthy for Kindergarten- A Family Literacy Program for Latino Families

lead_sponsor.agency: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

clinical_study.source: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

brief_summary.textblock: A pilot study of a health-focused family literacy program. The program will consist of a series of 8 weekly workshops centered around different health topics (e.g. physical activity) that introduce basic literacy skills. The workshops are designed for children entering kindergarten and their parents

detailed_description.textblock: This is a pilot study of a health-focused family literacy program. The program consists of 8 weekly health-themed workshops designed to introduce basic literacy skills to children entering Kindergarten and their parents. There will be a pre and post test assessment for participating parents and children. During the 8 weeks, parents will receive 2-3 weekly text messages to reinforce material presented at the weekly workshop.

primary_outcome.description: Acceptability will be measured using the Acceptability of Intervention Measure (AIM). The AIM consists of 4 questions that assess acceptability. Responses range from 1 (completely disagree) to 5 (completely agree). Scales are created by averaging responses.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At enrollment and after 8 week period.
secondary_outcome.description: Parent reported measure of the cognitive home environment for children 5 months to 6 years to assess aspects of the home environment that affect child development.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At enrollment and after 8 week period.
At enrollment and after 8 week period.
secondary_outcome.description: Sight word knowledge will be assessed

arm_group.arm_group_label: Ready and Healthy for Kindergarten Family Literacy Program
arm_group.description: Ready and Healthy for Kindergarten Family Literacy Program- 8 weekly parent child workshops with text message reminders

intervention.intervention_name: Ready and Healthy for Kindergarten Family Literacy program
intervention.description: Participants will participate in 8 parent-child health-themed literacy workshops. Participants will receive 2-3 text messages per week for 8 weeks.
intervention.arm_group_label: Ready and Healthy for Kindergarten Family Literacy Program

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Preferred language is either Spanish or English.
- Parent or legal guardian of child
- Parent age 18 or older
- Willing to accept text messages
Exclusion Criteria:
- Children not entering Kindergarten in Fall 2019 and their parents will be excluded

overall_official.affiliation: Rutgers Robert Wood Johnson Medical School

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey
